hh3cMplsLdp.name: hh3cMplsLdp

revisions.description: The MIB for H3CMPLS LDP module. This MIB has been derived from the MPLS Working group LDP MIB <drst-ietf-mpls-ldp-mib-01.txt> and MPLS Working group TE MIB <draft-ietf-mpls-te-mib -01.txt>.

hh3cMplsLdp.contactinfo: Platform Team Hangzhou H3C Tech. Co., Ltd. Hai-Dian District Beijing P.R. China http://www.h3c.com Zip:100085

MplsLsrIdentifier.name: MplsLsrIdentifier
MplsLsrIdentifier.description: The Label Switch Router (LSR) identifier is the first 4 bytes or the IP Address component of the Label Distribution Protocol (LDP) identifier.

MplsLdpGenAddr.name: MplsLdpGenAddr
MplsLdpGenAddr.description: The value of an network layer or data link layer address.

MplsLdpIdentifier.name: MplsLdpIdentifier
MplsLdpIdentifier.description: The LDP identifier is a six octet quantity which is used to identify an Label Switch Router (LSR) label space. The first four octets encode an IP address assigned to the LSR, and the last two octets identify a specific label space within the LSR.

AtmVpIdentifier.name: AtmVpIdentifier
AtmVpIdentifier.description: The VPI value for a VPL. The value VPI=0 is not used for a VPL not associated with a VCL. For ATM UNIs supporting VPCs the VPI value ranges from 1 to 255. For ATM UNIs supporting VCCs the VPI value ranges from 0 to 255. The maximum VPI value cannot exceed the value allowable by atmInterfaceMaxVpiBits defined in ATM-MIB.

AtmVcIdentifier.name: AtmVcIdentifier
AtmVcIdentifier.description: The VCI value for a VCL. The maximum VCI value cannot exceed the value allowable by atmInterfaceMaxVciBits defined in ATM-MIB.

AddressFamilyNumbers.name: AddressFamilyNumbers
AddressFamilyNumbers.description: An address family. Values are defined in RFC 1700 - Assigned Numbers. All values may not be relevant in all contexts when used in this MIB, but are included for completeness.
AddressFamilyNumbers.reference: RFC 1700 Assigned Numbers, Reynolds and Postel, Oct. 1994

MplsLabel.name: MplsLabel
MplsLabel.description: Represents an MPLS label. Note that the contents of a label field are interpreted in an interface-type specific fashion. For example, the label carried in the MPLS shim header is 20 bits wide and the top 12 bits must be zero. The frame relay label can be either 10, 17 or 23 bits wide depending on the size of the DLCI field size and the top 22, 15, or 9 bits must be zero, respectively. For an ATM interface, the lowermost 16 bits are interpreted as the VCI, the next 8 bits as the VPI and the remaining bits must be zero. Also note the permissible label values are also a function of the interface type. For example, the value 3 has special semantics in the control plane for an MPLS shim header label and is not a valid label value in the datapath.
MplsLabel.reference: 1. MPLS Label Stack Encoding, Rosen et al, draft- ietf-mpls-label-encaps-04.txt, April 1999. 2. Use of Label Switching on Frame Relay Networks, Conta et al, draft-ietf-mpls-fr-03.txt, Nov. 1998.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnTable
hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnTable.description: H3CMPLS provides support for multiple incarnations of the MPLS Stack in a target. The LSR defined in the standard <IETF DRAFT> MIB is treated as an incarnation in this MIB. Using a local policy the Network administrator must group the LDP Entities that should be placed in an incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnEntry
hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnEntry.description: An entry in this table represents an LSR incarnation. All the entries in this table are created initially when the LDP is initiated. The row status of each entry will be in 'notInService' state initially. The row status must be set to 'active' after the necessary configurations are complete with respect to an incarnation. Currenlty the LSR ID of the incarnation is the only mandatory parameter that must be set before the rowStatus is set to 'active'. An LSR Incarnation Entity is uniquely indexed by its Incarnation Identifier.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionPresent.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionPresent
hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionPresent.description: A indication of whether this LSR supports loop detection. A value of 'true' indicates this LSR does support loop detection. A value of 'false' indicates this LSR does not support loop detection.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionAdminStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionAdminStatus
hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionAdminStatus.description: To enable loop detection the value of this object should be 'enabled(1)'. Otherwise, to turn off loop detection, set this value to 'disabled(2)'.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrPathVectorLimit.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrPathVectorLimit
hh3cMplsLdpLsrPathVectorLimit.description: This object only has meaning if hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionPresent has the value of 'true'. The value of this object represents the limit of path vectors which this LSR uses to treat the message as if it had traversed a loop.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrHopCountLimit.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrHopCountLimit
hh3cMplsLdpLsrHopCountLimit.description: This object only has meaning if hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopDetectionPresent has the value of 'true'. The value of this object represents the limit on the Hop Count which this LSR uses to treat the message as if it had traversed a loop.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionPresent.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionPresent
hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionPresent.description: A indication of whether this LSR supports loop prevention. A value of 'true' indicates this LSR does support loop prevention. A value of 'false' indicates this LSR does not support loop prevention. Current release of H3CMPLS does not provide support to assign this MIB object with a value 'true'.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionAdminStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionAdminStatus
hh3cMplsLdpLsrLoopPreventionAdminStatus.description: To enable loop prevention the value of this object should be 'enabled(1)'. Otherwise, to turn off loop prevention, set this value to 'disabled(2)'. Current release of H3CMPLS does not provide support to assign this MIB object with a value 'enabled'.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrLabelRetentionMode.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrLabelRetentionMode
hh3cMplsLdpLsrLabelRetentionMode.description: The LSR can be configured to use either conservative or liberal label retention mode. If the value of this object is conservative(1) then advertized label mappings are retained only if they will be used to forward packets, i.e. if label came from a valid next hop. If the value of this object is liberal(2) then all advertized label mappings are retained whether they are from a valid next hop or not. Current release of H3CMPLS does not provide support to assign this MIB object with a value 'liberal'.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnID.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnID
hh3cMplsLdpLsrIncarnID.description: The incarnation acts as index to all the elements in this table.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLdpEntities.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLdpEntities
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLdpEntities.description: The maximum number of LDP entities that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLocalPeers.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLocalPeers
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLocalPeers.description: The maximum number of Local LDP peers that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxRemotePeers.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxRemotePeers
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxRemotePeers.description: The maximum number of Remote LDP peers that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxIfaces.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxIfaces
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxIfaces.description: The maximum number of Label enabled Interfaces that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLsps.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLsps
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxLsps.description: The maximum number of Label Switched Paths that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxCrlspTnls.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxCrlspTnls
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxCrlspTnls.description: The maximum number of CRLSPs that can be supported by this Incarnation.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxErhopPerCrlspTnl.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxErhopPerCrlspTnl
hh3cMplsLdpLsrMaxErhopPerCrlspTnl.description: The maximum number of ER-Hops that can be supported in a CRLSP tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpLsrRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpLsrRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpLsrRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityTable
hh3cMplsLdpEntityTable.description: This table contains information about the MPLS Label Distribution Protocol Entities which exist on this Label Switch Router (LSR).

hh3cMplsLdpEntityEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityEntry
hh3cMplsLdpEntityEntry.description: An entry in this table represents an LDP entity. An entry can be created by a network administrator or by an SNMP agent as instructed by LDP. An LPD Entity is uniquely indexed by its LPD Identifier.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityID.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityID
hh3cMplsLdpEntityID.reference: LDP Specification, Section on LDP Identifiers.
hh3cMplsLdpEntityID.description: The LDP identifier which uniquely identifies the LDP Entity. This is s six octet quantity which is used to identify an Label Switch Router (LSR) label space. The first four octets encode an IP address assigned to the LSR, and the last two octets identify a specific label space within the LSR.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelSpaceType.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelSpaceType
hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelSpaceType.reference: LDP Specification, Section on Label Spaces.
hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelSpaceType.description: The type of label spaces associated with this LDP Entity. The values are 'unknown(1)' The type of label space is not known. 'perInterface(2)' The type of label space is tied to an interface. 'perPlatform(3)' The type of label space is tied to the platform.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVpi.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVpi
hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVpi.description: The Default VPI value used in the label for the default VPI.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVci.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVci
hh3cMplsLdpEntityDefVci.description: The Default VCI value used in the label for the default VCI.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVpi.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVpi
hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVpi.description: VPI value of the VCC supporting unlabeled traffic.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVci.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVci
hh3cMplsLdpEntityUnlabTrafVci.description: VCI value of the VCC supporting unlabeled traffic.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityMergeCapability.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityMergeCapability
hh3cMplsLdpEntityMergeCapability.description: Sets the merge capability for this LDP entity. Current Release of H3CMPLS does not provide support for any kind of Merge.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityVcDirectionality.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityVcDirectionality
hh3cMplsLdpEntityVcDirectionality.description: Sets the VC directionality for this LDP entity.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityWellKnownDiscoveryPort.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityWellKnownDiscoveryPort
hh3cMplsLdpEntityWellKnownDiscoveryPort.description: The well known LDP Discovery Port.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityMtu.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityMtu
hh3cMplsLdpEntityMtu.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) that was configured for this entity.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityKeepAliveHoldTimer.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityKeepAliveHoldTimer
hh3cMplsLdpEntityKeepAliveHoldTimer.description: The two octet value which is the proposed keep alive hold timer for this LDP Entity.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityFailedInitSessionThresh.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityFailedInitSessionThreshold
hh3cMplsLdpEntityFailedInitSessionThresh.description: When attempting to establish a session with a given Peer, the given LDP Entity should send out a notification when exceeding this threshold. A value of 0 (zero) for this object indicates that the threshold is infinity. In other words, a notification will not be sent if the value of this object is 0 (zero).

hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelDistributionMethod.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelDistributionMethod
hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelDistributionMethod.description: For any given LDP session, the method of label distribution must be specified. Current release of H3CMPLS does not provide support for 'downstreamUnsolicited'.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelAllocationMethod.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelAllocationMethod
hh3cMplsLdpEntityLabelAllocationMethod.description: For any given LDP session, the method of label allocation must be specified. Label can be allocated in either ordered mode or in the independent mode.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityHelloHoldTimer.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityHelloHoldTimer
hh3cMplsLdpEntityHelloHoldTimer.description: The two octet value which is the proposed hello hold timer for this LDP Entity.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpEntityRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfTable
hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfTable.description: This table contains information about the interfaces that are associated with an LDP Entity. There should be atleast one interface associated with each LDP Entity. If the LDP Entity supports 'per interface based label space' label type then, atmost one interface can be associated with the LDP entity. If the LDP Entity supports 'per platform based label space' label type then, more than one interface can be associated with the LDP Entity.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfEntry
hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfEntry.description: An entry in this table represents an Interface that is associated with a LDP entity. An entry can be created by a network administrator or by an SNMP agent as instructed by LDP. An interface (row in this table) can be created/deleted only when the associted LDP Entity row status has the value notInService or notReady.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIndex.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIndex
hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIndex.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies the Interface with respect to an LDP Entity. The ifIndex value corresponds to the IfIndex value of the MIB-II

hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIpv4Address.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIpv4Address
hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfIpv4Address.description: The IPv4 address associated with the interface.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpEntityIfRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeTable
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeTable.description: The MPLS LDP Entity Configurable ATM Label Range Table. The purpose of this table is to provide a mechanism for specifying a contiguous range of vpi's with a contiguous range of vci's, or a 'label range' for LDP Entities. LDP Entities which use ATM must have at least one entry in this table.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeEntry
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeEntry.description: A row in the LDP Entity Configurable ATM Label Range Table. One entry in this table contains information on a single range of labels represented by the configured Upper and Lower Bounds VPI/VCI pairs. NOTE: The ranges for a specific LDP Entity are UNIQUE and non-overlapping. For example, for a specific LDP Entity index, there could be one entry having ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/32, and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/100, and a second entry for this same interface with ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/101 and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/200. However, there could not be a third entry with ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/200 and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/300 because this label range overlaps with the second entry (i.e. both entries now have 0/200). A row will not be created unless a unique and non-overlapping range is specified. Thus, row creation implies a one-shot row creation of LDP EntityID and ConfLowerBound vpi/vci and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci. At least one label range entry for a specific LDP Entity MUST include the default VPI/VCI values denoted in the LDP Entity Table.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerB.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerB.description: The minimum VPI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerB.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeLowerB.description: The minimum VCI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperB.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperB.description: The maximum VPI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperB.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeUpperB.description: The maximum VCI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeRowSta.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpEntityConfAtmLabelRangeRowSta.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsTable
hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsTable.description: This table is a read-only table which augments the MplsLdpConfEntityTable. The purpose of this table is to keep statistical information about the LDP Entities on the LSR.

hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsEntry
hh3cMplsLdpEntityStatsEntry.description: A row in this table contains statistical information about an LDP Entity.

hh3cMplsLdpAttemptedSessions.name: hh3cMplsLdpAttemptedSessions
hh3cMplsLdpAttemptedSessions.description: A count of the total attempted sessions for this LDP Entity.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerTable
hh3cMplsLdpPeerTable.description: Information about LDP peers which have been discovered by the LDP Entities that are managed by this agent.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerIndex.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerIndex
hh3cMplsLdpPeerIndex.description: An identifier for the LDP peer that is unique within the scope of this agent.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerID.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerID
hh3cMplsLdpPeerID.description: The LDP identifier of this LDP Peer.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddrType.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddrType
hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddrType.description: The type of the internetwork layer address of this LDP peer. This object indicates how the value of hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddr is to be interpreted.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddr.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddr
hh3cMplsLdpPeerInternetworkAddr.description: The value of the internetwork layer address of this LDP peer.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerDefaultMtu.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerDefaultMtu
hh3cMplsLdpPeerDefaultMtu.description: The default maximum transmission unit (MTU) of the LDP Peer.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerKeepAliveHoldTimer.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerKeepAliveHoldTimer
hh3cMplsLdpPeerKeepAliveHoldTimer.description: The two octet unsigned non zero INTEGER that indicates the number of seconds that this Peer proposes for the value of the KeepAlive Interval.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerLabelDistributionMethod.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerLabelDistributionMethod
hh3cMplsLdpPeerLabelDistributionMethod.description: For any given LDP session, the method of label distribution must be specified.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerType.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerType
hh3cMplsLdpPeerType.description: Indicates whether a peer is a local peer or a remote peer

hh3cMplsLdpPeerRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpPeerRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeTable
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeTable.description: The MPLS LDP Peer Configurable ATM Label Range Table. The purpose of this table is to provide a mechanism for specifying a contiguous range of vpi's with a contiguous range of vci's, or a 'label range' for LDP Peers. LDP Peers which use ATM must have at least one entry in this table.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeEntry
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeEntry.description: A row in the LDP Peer Configurable ATM Label Range Table. One entry in this table contains information on a single range of labels represented by the configured Upper and Lower Bounds VPI/VCI pairs. NOTE: The ranges for a specific LDP Peer are UNIQUE and non-overlapping. For example, for a specific LDP Peer index, there could be one entry having ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/32, and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/100, and a second entry for this same interface with ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/101 and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/200. However, there could not be a third entry with ConfLowerBound vpi/vci == 0/200 and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci == 0/300 because this label range overlaps with the second entry (i.e. both entries now have 0/200). A row will not be created unless a unique and non-overlapping range is specified. Thus, row creation implies a one-shot row creation of LDP PeerIndex and ConfLowerBound vpi/vci and ConfUpperBound vpi/vci. At least one label range entry for a specific LDP Peer MUST include the default VPI/VCI values denoted in the LDP Peer Table.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBou.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBou.description: The minimum VPI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBou.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeLowerBou.description: The minimum VCI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBou.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBou.description: The maximum VPI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBou.name: hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpPeerConfAtmLabelRangeUpperBou.description: The maximum VCI number configured for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionTable
hh3cMplsLdpSessionTable.description: A table of Sessions between the LDP Entities and LDP Peers.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionEntry
hh3cMplsLdpSessionEntry.description: An entry in this table represents information on a single session between an LDP Entity and LDP Peer.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionIndex.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionIndex
hh3cMplsLdpSessionIndex.description: An unique identifier for this entry such that it identifies a specific LDP Session.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionProtocolVersion.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionProtocolVersion
hh3cMplsLdpSessionProtocolVersion.description: The version of the LDP Protocol which this session is using.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionKeepAliveHoldTimeRemai.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionKeepAliveHoldTimeRemaining
hh3cMplsLdpSessionKeepAliveHoldTimeRemai.description: The keep alive hold time remaining for this session.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionRole.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionRole
hh3cMplsLdpSessionRole.description: An indication of whether the LDP Entity associated with this session is acting in an 'active' role or a 'passive' role.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionState.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionState
hh3cMplsLdpSessionState.description: The current state of the session, all of the states 1 - 5 are based on the state machine for session negotiation behavior.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoun.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoun.description: The minimum VPI number for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoun.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeLowerBoun.description: The minimum VCI number for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoun.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVPI
hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoun.description: The maximum VPI number for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoun.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoundVCI
hh3cMplsLdpSessionAtmLabelRangeUpperBoun.description: The maximum VCI number for this range.

hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyTable
hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyTable.description: A table of Hello Adjacencies for Sessions.

hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyEntry
hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyEntry.description: Each row represents a single LDP Hello Adjacency. An LDP Session can have one or more Hello adjacencies.

hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyHoldTimeRemaini.name: hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyHoldTimeRemaining
hh3cMplsLdpHelloAdjacencyHoldTimeRemaini.description: The time remaining for this Hello Adjacency.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable.description: The hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable allows new CRLSP MPLS tunnels to be created. The ER hops associated with a CRLSP tunnel are to be configured using the hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopTable.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlEntry
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlEntry.description: An entry in this table represents an CRLSP MPLS tunnel. An entry can be created by a network administrator.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlName.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlName
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlName.description: The 'canonical' name assigned to the tunnel that can be used to refer to it on the 'console' port.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlDirection.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlDirection
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlDirection.description: Whether this tunnel is unidirectional-incoming, unidirectional-outgoing, or bidirectional.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSignallingProto.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSignallingProto
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSignallingProto.description: The signaling protocol, if any, that set up this tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSetupPrio.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSetupPrio
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSetupPrio.reference: Extensions to RSVP for LSP Tunnels, Awduche et al, Internet Draft <draft-mpls-rsvp-lsp-tunnel-02.txt>, March 1999., Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, Internet Draft <draft-ietf-mpls-cr-ldp- 01.txt>, Feb. 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlSetupPrio.description: The setup priority of this tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlHoldingPrio.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlHoldingPrio
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlHoldingPrio.reference: Extensions to RSVP for LSP Tunnels, Awduche et al, Internet Draft <draft-mpls-rsvp-lsp-tunnel-02.txt>, March 1999., Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, Internet Draft <draft-ietf-mpls-cr-ldp- 01.txt>, Feb. 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlHoldingPrio.description: The holding priority for this tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakDataRate.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakDataRate
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakDataRate.reference: Section 4.3.1.2, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakDataRate.description: The peak rate - the maximum rate at which traffic will be sent on the CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakBurstSize.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakBurstSize
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakBurstSize.reference: Section 4.3, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlPeakBurstSize.description: The peak burst size - the maximum burst size of the traffic that can occur in the established CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedDataRate.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedDataRate
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedDataRate.reference: Section 4.3.1.3, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedDataRate.description: The committed rate - the committed rate at which traffic will be sent on the CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedBurstSize.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedBurstSize
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedBurstSize.reference: Section 4.3, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlCommittedBurstSize.description: The committed burst size - the committed burst size of the traffic that will be handled in the established CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlExcessBurstSize.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlExcessBurstSize
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlExcessBurstSize.reference: Section 4.3.1.4, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlExcessBurstSize.description: The Excess burst size - the excess burst size limit to be used for traffic conditioning at the ingress of the CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlIsPinned.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlIsPinned
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlIsPinned.description: Indicates whether the loose-routed hops of this tunnel are to be pinned.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlFrequency.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlFrequency
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlFrequency.reference: Section 4.3.1.1, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency of usage of the established CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlWeight.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlWeight
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlWeight.reference: Section 4.3, Constraint-Based LSP Setup using LDP, Jamoussi, et. al, <draft-ietf-mpls-crldp-02.txt>, August 1999.
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlWeight.description: Indicates the weight that is the established CRLSP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlRowStatus.description: For controlling the state of this row. The status can be set to 'active' only when atleast one ERHOP is created in the hh3cMplsLdpErHopTable, associated with this tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopTable.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopTable
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopTable.description: The hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopTable is used to indicate the hops, strict or loose, for an MPLS CRLSP tunnel defined in hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable. There must be atleast one entry in this table for each CRLSP tunnel that is supported in the hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTnlTable. The first row in the table is the first hop after the origination point of the tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopEntry.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopEntry
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopEntry.description: An entry in this table represents a tunnel hop. An entry is created by a network administrator for signalled ERLSP set up by LDP or RSVP.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIndex.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIndex
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIndex.description: Secondary index into this table identifying the particular hop.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4Addr.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4Addr
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4Addr.description: If hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopAddrType is ipV4(1), IPv4 address of this hop. This object is not significant otherwise and should return a value of 0.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4PrefixLen.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4PrefixLen
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopIpv4PrefixLen.description: If hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopAddrType is ipV4(1), prefix length for this hop's IPv4 address. This object is not significant otherwise and should return a value of 0.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopStrictOrLoose.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopStrictOrLoose
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopStrictOrLoose.description: Whether this is a strict or loose hop.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopRowStatus.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopRowStatus
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspErHopRowStatus.description: For creating, modifying and deleting this row.

hh3cMplsLdpFailedInitSessionThresholdExc.name: hh3cMplsLdpFailedInitSessionThresholdExceeded
hh3cMplsLdpFailedInitSessionThresholdExc.description: This notification is generated whenever the value of hh3cMplsLdpEntityFailedInitSessionThreshold is exceeded.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelUp.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelUp
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelUp.description: This notification is generated by the Ingress LSR of the CRLSP tunnel on the receipt of Label mapping message from the downstream LSR for the LAbel request sent for the CRLSP tunnel.

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelDown.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelDown
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelDown.description: This notification is generated when a CRLSP Row status is modified to destroy the CRLSP tunnel. - due to pre-emption etc.,

hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelSetupFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelSetupFailure
hh3cMplsLdpCrlspTunnelSetupFailure.description: This notification is generated by the Ingress LSR of the CRLSP tunnel on the receipt of Nak message from the downstream LSR for the Label request sent for the CRLSP tunnel. This can occur due to improper ER hop values being set, or Traffic resources not available etc.,

hh3cMplsLdpIncarnUpEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpIncarnUpEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpIncarnUpEventFailure.description: This notification is generated by LDP to notify the Incarnation UP Event failure

hh3cMplsLdpIncarnDownEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpIncarnDownEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpIncarnDownEventFailure.description: This notification is generated by LDP to notify the Incarnation DOWN Event failure

hh3cMplsLdpEntityUpEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityUpEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpEntityUpEventFailure.description: This notification is generated by LDP to notify the ENTITY UP Event failure

hh3cMplsLdpEntityDownEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpEntityDownEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpEntityDownEventFailure.description: This notification is generated by LDP to notify the ENTITY DOWN Event failure

hh3cMplsLdpSessionUpEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionUpEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpSessionUpEventFailure.description: Generation of this trap occurs when the value of 'hh3cMplsLdpSessionState' enters the 'operational(5)' state.

hh3cMplsLdpSessionDownEventFailure.name: hh3cMplsLdpSessionDownEventFailure
hh3cMplsLdpSessionDownEventFailure.description: Generation of this trap occurs when the value of 'hh3cMplsLdpSessionState' leaves the 'operational(5)' state.
